description.narrative: The aim of this programme is to support the Government of Sierra Leone (GoSL) to reduce maternal, neonatal and under-5 mortality and morbidity by increasing utilisation of quality Reproductive, Maternal, Neonatal, Child and Adolescent Health (RMNCAH) services. This will be achieved through a multifaceted approach to strengthen quality, expand access, and build the demand for RMNCAH services in Sierra Leone.

activity-date.narrative: CUAMM- DOCTORS WITH AFRICA UNITE FO SEV LAYF NA SALONE – ACTIVITY SUMMARY QUARTERLY REPORT QUARTER ONE – JAN - MARCH, 2019 MAIN ACTIVITY COMPLETED DURING THE QUARTER ACHIEVEMENT • Coordination of health partners meeting • CUAMM supported 4 District coordination meetings where activities and plans of the district were discussed. Of the 14 actions agreed, only 6 were completed by the end of the quarter for the two supported districts • Support to PUH In charges Meting • Four PHU staff in-charges meeting was done in Pujehun and Bonthe. Data presentation done in both meeting was captioned on EPI coverage, ANC 1 VS ANC 4 and Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) practice in PHUs. • Maternal death Investigation • A total of 9 maternal deaths were reported in the two districts (3 Bonthe, 6 Pujehun). • Maternal deaths review Meetings completed with action points • Two review meetings conducted per district to review 4 maternal deaths. Nine action point was developed in Pujehun and Bonthe had 3 action point developed. In Bonthe all three-action point was achieved. None was reached in Pujehun. • MDSR community feedback meeting was conducted in both districts from recommendations and action points made from review meting conducted. • Support to development of standard operating procedures (SOPs.) • CUAMM started the development of SOPs related to fuel support and they are expected to be discussed and endorsed by the DHMT in the next quarter • Integrated Supportive supervision and other supervisions • CUAMM also supported the DHMT Integrated Supportive Supervision in Bonthe district where 51 PHUs were visited and of these, 50 PHUs submitted a completed checklist to the DHMT. Action points from this activity were actioned with one pending for the repair of drug cupboards on ANC couches and was later followed and achieved in previous quarter. • Apart from the ISSV data cleaning exercise was completed to 15 PHUs in Bonthe district. This exercise helped PHUs on data quality and recording. • Support to Pediatrics and obstetric referrals • There was no support to this activity as there were no clinical mentors in operation this time • RMNCHA and EmONC trainings conducted • CUAMM conducted 10 days EmONC training for 37 District Clinical Mentors (DCMs) in March. The training was co-facilitated by MoHS EmONC coordinators. Pre and post test scores were 62% and 86% respectively. CUAMM also co-facilitated together with IRC and MoHS a four days mentorship model training 37 clinical mentors of the consortium this quarter as well. • Mentorship on EmONC and IMNCI • The recruitment of District Clinical Mentors was completed in this quarter, out of four DCMs for CUAMM, three is on seconded by the MoHS. • CUAMM collaborated with other Consortium partners to finalized the Mentorship framework a document that will be used as a guide for the mentorship piece of the saving lives project. • Blood Donation Activities Supported • A joint blood bank assessment was conducted between CUAMM and the MoHS blood bank manager in 10 supported district hospitals and 1 mission hospital (UBC) as per request by MoHS Laboratory and Blood services director. This activity was supported by CUAMM blood bank specialist for the saving lives project. • CUAMM in Pujehun supported two (2) mobile blood drives at Bandajuma and Zimmi where seventy-five (75) units of blood were collected for each drive. Bonthe did one static blood drive and fifteen units of blood were collected and the hospital utilise an average of eleven (11) units per month). • DHMT/Hospital Operation support • CUAMM supported the two Districts and Hospitals in implementing other activities in the AWPs, including: daily fuel for generators, communication support, stationery, data cleaning exercise. This support was given to both DHMT and hospital operation. • Flexible fund supports • Others Activities completed • In January 2019, CUAMM supported the DHMT of Pujehun in responding to the Measles outbreak in Pujehun where 4 cases had been confirmed positive. Support was offered for active case search, line listing and laboratory investigations for the 17 affected communities; this was followed by 17 community meetings in the affected 4 chiefdoms with CHWs conducting village, house and market awareness. Radio discussions and 2 district coordination meetings were supported
